item.title: Rubio’s verbal assault on Trump continues, joined by seven-figure ad buys
item.description: OKLAHOMA CITY — It was the biggest crowd Sen. Marco Rubio (R-Fla.) had gotten in this state, perhaps a thousand voters filling the floor of a downtown event center to hear him. And for 10 minutes, that crowd was asked to laugh along with Rubio as he warned them to not “lose the conservative movement to […]
item.dc:creator: David Weigel

item.title: Fired by Cruz, a former spokesman votes for him anyway
item.description: Five days after being asked to resign by Sen. Ted Cruz (R-Tex.), conservative strategist Rick Tyler shared his Virginia ballot on Facebook. He had voted for the old boss. Tyler's departure from the campaign came after Sen. Marco Rubio (R-Fla.) insisted there be "accountability" for Cruz's tactics, and after Tyler himself shared a video that falsely […]
item.dc:creator: David Weigel

item.title: On eve of primary, Sanders returns to less-than-capacity crowds in South Carolina
item.description: COLUMBIA, S.C. -- After a 48-hour absence, presidential hopeful Bernie Sanders returned Friday to South Carolina on the eve of the Democratic primary to a reminder of the long odds he faces here: one of the smallest turnouts for a rally of his in some time. There were far more empty seats than filled ones […]
item.dc:creator: John Wagner

item.title: Clinton confronted by protesters at South Carolina campus
item.description: ORANGEBURG, S.C. — Protesters sympathetic to the Black Lives Matter movement interrupted Democratic presidential candidate Hillary Clinton Friday afternoon at an event looking to rally young voters at South Carolina State University. It was unclear whether the two protesters — two of only a handful of white people in the audience at South Carolina’s only […]
item.dc:creator: Jeremy Borden

item.title: Cruz: Trump has ‘enormous momentum’
item.description: The Texas senator said Friday that it's up to voters in states that vote on "Super Tuesday" to end Trump's winning streak.
item.dc:creator: Katie Zezima

item.title: Sanders rips Clinton for donations from ‘those who would profit off the destruction of the planet’
item.description: HIBBING, Minn. -- Democratic presidential hopeful Bernie Sanders on Friday opened a new line of attack on Hillary Clinton, sharply questioning her ability to address climate change because her campaign has taken money from supporters of hydraulic fracturing. “Just as I believe you can’t take on Wall Street while taking their money, I don’t believe […]
item.dc:creator: John Wagner

item.title: While endorsing Trump, Christie takes shots at Rubio
item.description: FORT WORTH — Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump on Friday received the high-profile endorsement of New Jersey Gov. Chris Christie (R), a stunning blow to the four remaining GOP White House hopefuls who are urgently working to obstruct the billionaire’s path to the nomination. “I've gotten to know all the people on that stage, and there is no one who is […]
item.dc:creator: Jose A. DelReal

item.title: On the eve of the South Carolina primary, Sharpton is still mum on endorsement
item.description: The Rev. Al Sharpton, who twice summoned Democrats Hillary Clinton and Bernie Sanders to meetings in a competition for his endorsement, still has not decided whether he will support a candidate, as large numbers of African Americans prepare to vote in primaries across the South. “As of now he’s made no decision and whether he […]
item.dc:creator: Vanessa Williams

item.title: Conservative nonprofit attacks Trump University in new ads
item.description: OKLAHOMA CITY -- A retiree says he was "duped by the Donald" and lost $35,000 to Trump University, a short-lived and controversial Donald Trump business venture. A single mom says she "made a huge mistake trusting him" and lost just as much money, maybe more. A man identified only as "Kevin" says Trump University ruined […]
item.dc:creator: Jenna Johnson

item.title: What happens when Hillary Clinton crashes a bachelor party? She’s in the photos.
item.description: The campaign trail has taken Hillary Clinton through coffee shops and bakeries, diners and ice cream parlors, stands at state fairs where they fry things that shouldn't be fried. And, Friday, it took her to a bachelor party. Joe Schreck and his 10 groomsmen were toasting Schreck ahead of his wedding with a round of […]
item.dc:creator: Anne Gearan

item.title: Trump has bladder issues, suggests Rubio as he unleashes a torrent of attacks at first post-debate rally
item.description: DALLAS — For the first eight minutes of his final pre-Super Tuesday rally in Texas, Sen. Marco Rubio (R-Fla.) ditched one of the tightest stump speeches in politics and hurled a luxury tower's worth of kitchen sinks at Donald Trump. He mocked his age. He claimed "every" Trump business had gone bankrupt. And then he speculated, in […]
item.dc:creator: David Weigel

item.title: That time Marco Rubio went full Trump on Donald Trump
item.description: Florida Sen. Marco Rubio re-upped his attacks on GOP presidential front-runner Donald Trump on Friday, repeating some of the lines he used during Thursday night's Republican debate but also others not uttered before. In essence, Rubio used Trump-style tactics against Trump, mocking the businessman for his appearance, his misspelled tweets and his questionable business record. […]
item.dc:creator: Ed O'Keefe

item.title: Rubio’s ridicule, Cruz’s litmus tests: The two ways of attacking Trump
item.description: HOUSTON -- After Sen. Marco Rubio of Florida was pronounced the winner of Thursday night's GOP debate in Houston, his strategist Todd Harris was asked whether the attacks on Donald Trump had been a little glib. Rubio seemed pre-loaded with zingers -- Trump would be "selling watches in Manhattan" if he hadn't "inherited $200 million" […]
item.dc:creator: David Weigel

item.title: Donald Trump says IRS audits could be tied to being a ‘strong Christian’
item.description: In explaining why the Internal Revenue Service audits him every year, Donald Trump suggested Thursday night that the government agency has unfairly targeted him because of his religion. "I'm always audited by the IRS, which I think is very unfair — I don't know, maybe because of religion, maybe because of something else, maybe because I'm doing this, although […]
item.dc:creator: Jenna Johnson

item.title: Sanders unloads on Clinton during raucous speech in Chicago
item.description: CHICAGO -- Democratic presidential hopeful Bernie Sanders, who’s complained about having “the kitchen sink” thrown at him, unloaded on Hillary Clinton here Thursday night, ticking off a series of issues on which he said the former secretary of state had taken the wrong position. The Vermont senator attacked Clinton for having accepted campaign contributions and […]
item.dc:creator: John Wagner

item.title: Sanders visits Flint, says water contamination points to need for more infrastructure spending
item.description: FLINT, Mich. -- On Thursday afternoon, Bernie Sanders emerged with his wife to the same uptempo music, Bruce Springsteen’s “We Take Care Of Our Own,” as he does at all of his rallies. The crowd stood and cheered enthusiastically, as they always do, with some supporters wearing “Bernie” T-shirts and screaming his name. To that […]
item.dc:creator: John Wagner

item.title: Rubio previews a sharper anti-Trump message to donors
item.description: HOUSTON -- On Wednesday night, as Sen. Ted Cruz (R-Tex.) spoke to Harris County Republicans, Sen. Marco Rubio (R-Fla.)  went to the St. Regis Hotel for a $1,000-minimum fundraiser. When one donor asked about trade, he was surprised to hear Rubio turn the question back on an absent Donald Trump. Slapping tariffs on China, as Trump […]
item.dc:creator: David Weigel

item.title: Former Mexican president says he will not pay for Donald Trump’s ‘f—— wall’
item.description: Former Mexican president Vicente Fox is fiercely opposed to his country paying for the massive wall that Donald Trump wants to build on the border between their two countries, saying in an interview that Trump is "a crazy guy" and "a false prophet" who should not be elected president. "I'm not going to pay for that f------ wall," […]
item.dc:creator: Jenna Johnson

item.title: Clinton regrets 1996 remark on ‘super-predators’ after encounter with activist
item.description: COLUMBIA, S.C. — Black voters are the linchpin of Hillary Clinton's strategy for winning the South Carolina Democratic presidential primary, and as a result, her campaign has put racial justice issues at the forefront of her agenda. But at an event on Wednesday night, Clinton was vocally confronted by an activist questioning her past support […]
item.dc:creator: Anne Gearan and Abby Phillip

item.title: Rubio showing signs of a more aggressive posture toward Trump
item.description: Ahead of Thursday night's Republican presidential debate in Houston, Sen. Marco Rubio (R-Fla.), who has long treaded carefully around Donald Trump, is signaling a more aggressive posture toward the GOP front-runner. In remarks in Houston on Wednesday, Rubio took the rare step of attacking Trump by name at a campaign rally. And on Thursday morning, […]
item.dc:creator: Sean Sullivan
